ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Story Time
ygData.msgSnippet: Woohoo!  Congrats! I got to admit I m cracking up picturing this, but not picturing it in the EQ graphics sense, but as a scene in a movie where aged wizards
ygData.messageBody:
Woohoo! Congrats!

I got to admit I'm cracking up picturing this, but not picturing it in the
EQ graphics sense, but as a scene in a movie where aged wizards are flipping
through spell books, standing, wiggling their fingers, frowning at the
results, and sitting back down to flip through more pages while a teeny,
tiny, itsy-bitsy, little minstral, staring straight up and hacking blindly
at the toes before him, belts out "Here I come to save the day!" through a
mega-phone.

Anyway, it's cracking me up. ;^)

Peace
Evulia, bard of 11 missed notes, Tunare

> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Beckemeier [mailto:Beckemej@...]
> Sent: Monday, July 03, 2000 1:59 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Story Time
>
>
> Ok children, get comfy, I feel like relating one of Knaeve's
> Tales of the
> Ludicrous. I usually just lurk on the list, but I have time
> to kill at
> work, and feel like sharing.
>
> So anyway, I'm grouped with a cleric doing CR after a failed
> Vox run. We
> had learned the hard way that 53+ clerics, even if they don't
> engage Vox,
> still get zapped out of the zone if they get even remotely
> close (this was
> right after the patch). I was pumping mana and there were
> about a dozen
> people in the room, all of whom, by pure coincidence, were
> casters. And
> they were all very LOM casters since they'd just been rez'd.
> Somehow, two
> lvl 50 Ice Giants agro'd on us. I charmed one for a while
> and had them
> duel, but I myself had recently been rez'd, so I ran out of
> mana. The
> casters, using what little shred of mana was left, reduced
> one to ashes.
>
> Thus began The Bardic Prize Fight of the Century (may it
> never be repeated).
>
> The bad news: I DIDN'T HAVE ANY CHANTS MEM'D!!!
>
> F1
> /bonk
>
> The good news: I had VoV, Niv's, and CoB mem'd from working with some
> melee's earlier to clear out the king room as we worked back
> mostly naked to
> the CR (the other melee had left, and as I've stated, I was
> the ONLY melee
> in this room of OOM casters).
>
> The other good news: I have Sionachie's Partisan (only one on
> Quel server to
> my knowledge... I'll tack the stats to the end of this post)
> which I'm very
> fond of.
>
> So I start to melee this frigging lvl 50 ice giant while
> everyone med's
> furiously. Everyone who could heal had me targeted and so I would
> periodically get incoming greater heals. Every once in a
> while a caster
> would get enough mana for a nuke--but by some freakish chance
> everyone was
> getting horrid resists & partial resists. And the fight went
> on. And on.
> And on. While I tanked, twisted, and meleed the huge
> bastard. AFter about
> two minutes, the cleric I had been mana feeding earlier asked
> how stamina
> was doing. "Out." So he shot me a bar of stamina. It was
> sort of like the
> people on the sidelines of the marathon handing a cup of
> gatorade to one of
> the runners. It took 5 minutes to kill him. Over that period I was
> probably the recipient of 30 greater heals. It was one of the most
> ludicrous settings I've seen--all these powerless casters
> watching the lone
> bard take on something with maybe 8-10k hp.
>
> Suffice it to say, me and the one person I was grouped with
> (cleric) got the
> xp for the kill.
>
> Knaeve, blah blah blah blah blah.
>
> .
> .
> .
> .
> .
> Sionachie's Partisan:
>
> 9/19 +6cha +2int +5MR
>
>
